text_snippet: 1.1 “Confidential Information” shall mean any and all data, materials, documents, specifications, designs, drawings, models, samples, reports, analyses, or any other information furnished by Discloser, whether in written, electronic, graphic, oral, or any other form, but only to the extent that such information is labeled or otherwise identified in writing by Discloser as “Confidential” at the time of disclosure. Confidential Information shall not include information which (a) is or becomes publicly known through no wrongful act of Recipient; (b) was rightfully in Recipient’s possession prior to receipt from Discloser; (c) is rightfully obtained by Recipient from a third party having the right to disclose; or (d) is independently developed by Recipient without use of or reference to Discloser’s Confidential Information.
suggested_fix: 1.1 “Confidential Information” means all information of a confidential nature owned or used by, or relating to Discloser, in any form including, but not limited to, oral, written, or electronic. This encompasses information regardless of whether it is identified or designated as "Confidential" or "Proprietary," as well as information which, by the nature of the information itself or the circumstances of its disclosure, should reasonably be understood by Recipient to be treated as confidential. Confidential Information includes information disclosed prior to, on, or after the date of this agreement's signature. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Confidential Information does not include information which: (a) becomes part of the public domain through no wrongful act of Recipient; (b) was in Recipient’s possession prior to disclosure by Discloser and was not subject to a duty of confidentiality; (c) is received from a third party lawfully in possession of such information and not in violation of any contractual or legal obligation to keep such information confidential; or (d) is independently developed by Recipient without reference to or reliance upon the Confidential Information of Discloser.

text_snippet:
2.1 Recipient agrees to exercise at least the same degree of care to safeguard the confidentiality of Confidential Information as it uses to protect its own similar confidential materials, but in no event less than a reasonable standard of care.
      2.2 Recipient may use Confidential Information solely for its own internal business purposes, including, without limitation, evaluation, analysis, or discussion concerning a potential business relationship or transaction with Discloser. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary herein, Recipient may disclose Confidential Information to its employees, officers, affiliates, agents, subcontractors, and consultants (collectively, “Representatives”) who have a bona fide need to know such information in connection with the permitted uses set forth above, provided that Recipient has first obtained binding confidentiality obligations from such Representatives that are no less stringent than those set forth in this Agreement.

6.1 If Recipient or any of its Representatives is required by applicable law, regulation, or judicial or governmental order to disclose any Confidential Information, Recipient may do so without prior notice to Discloser and without seeking to limit the scope of such disclosure. Recipient shall have no obligation to notify Discloser or cooperate in any efforts to seek a protective order or other limitation on the scope of such compelled disclosure.
suggested_fix:
6.1 Disclosure Required by Law: Notwithstanding any other provision of this Agreement, in the event that the Recipient or any of its Representatives is legally compelled by applicable law, regulation, or by judicial or administrative order to disclose any of the Discloser's Confidential Information, the Recipient may disclose such information to the extent required, provided that the Recipient:

(a) furnishes the Discloser with prompt written notice of such requirement prior to disclosure, to the extent that such notice is legally permissible and practicable, except when such disclosure is in connection with a routine audit or examination by, or a blanket document request from, a regulatory or governmental entity that does not specifically reference the Discloser or the terms of this Agreement;

(b) consults with the Discloser to the extent practicable regarding the possibility of taking legally available steps to resist or narrow such request or order and, if the Discloser seeks to limit the disclosure, the Recipient agrees to cooperate with the Discloser in any attempt to obtain an appropriate protective order or other reliable assurance that confidential treatment will be accorded to the disclosed Confidential Information by the authority or person to which it is disclosed; and

(c) uses reasonable efforts to obtain an assurance that the Confidential Information so disclosed will be treated confidentially by the authority or person to which it is disclosed, to the extent that such an assurance is legally obtainable.

text_snippet: 5.1 Upon written request of Discloser or upon termination of this Agreement, Recipient may, at its sole discretion, either return to Discloser or destroy all physical and electronic embodiments of Confidential Information. Recipient shall not be obligated to provide any certification or other proof of destruction or return of materials.
suggested_fix:
5.1 Upon receipt of a written request from Discloser, Recipient shall:

(a) return to Discloser all documents and materials (including any originals, copies, reproductions, or summaries) containing Confidential Information; or

(b) at the option of Discloser, destroy all such documents and materials. 

Recipient shall then certify in writing, within a reasonable time after destruction, that it has complied with these requirements.

text_snippet: 8.1 Neither Party shall have any liability to the other for any unauthorized disclosure, use, or loss of Confidential Information. Recipient shall not be liable for any breach of confidentiality, and Discloser waives any claims for damages or injunctive relief.
suggested_fix:
8.1 Recipient shall indemnify, defend, and hold Discloser (and Discloser's personnel) harmless against any and all loss, damage (including attorneys' fees on an attorney and own client basis), costs, and expenses that Discloser may suffer or incur arising directly or indirectly from:
   (a) a failure by Recipient's personnel to abide by their obligations of confidentiality and non-disclosure;
   (b) any breach of the provisions of this agreement; or
   (c) any wilful misconduct or fraud by Recipient or Recipient's personnel.

text_snippet: 10.1 All notices, requests, consents, claims, demands, waivers, and other communications hereunder shall be in writing and shall be deemed to have been given (a) when delivered by hand (with written confirmation of receipt); (b) when received by the addressee if sent by a nationally recognized overnight courier (with written confirmation of receipt); or (c) on the date sent by email (with electronic confirmation of transmission). Email shall suffice as notice notwithstanding any failure of the intended recipient to receive such email.
suggested_fix:
10.1 Notices. The parties agree to send all notices, authorizations, disclosures, acknowledgements, or requests (collectively, "Notices") pursuant to this Agreement by hand delivery, prepaid registered post, fax, or email to the address or number provided herein.

10.2 Service Address. Each party designates its street address and number set forth in this Agreement as its domicilium citandi et executandi (the address for service of legal documents) for the purposes of this Agreement.

10.3 Change of Address or Number. A party may change its service address or number to another location within the same country by providing written notice to the other party at least 14 days prior to the change.

10.4 Deemed Delivery. A Notice shall be deemed delivered on the date indicated on the confirmation of delivery for hand-delivered, prepaid registered post, courier, fax, or email communications.

10.5 Actual Receipt. Notwithstanding the above, actual receipt of a Notice or other communication by a party shall be deemed effective notice for the purposes of this Agreement.

text_snippet: 9.1 Recipient may freely assign, transfer, or delegate its rights and obligations under this Agreement, in whole or in part, to any affiliate, successor, or acquirer, without the need for any consent or notice to Discloser. Discloser may assign its rights and obligations hereunder without restriction.
suggested_fix: 9.1 Assignment and Delegation. Neither party may delegate its duties under this Agreement nor assign its rights hereunder, in whole or in part. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Discloser may assign this Agreement to any successor or purchaser of its business or of a portion of its assets.

text_snippet:
12.1 This Agreement constitutes the entire understanding between the Parties with respect to its subject matter and supersedes all prior or contemporaneous discussions, agreements, and understandings of any kind.
      12.2 If any provision of this Agreement is held to be invalid or unenforceable, such provision shall be struck and the remaining provisions shall remain in full force and effect.
      12.3 No waiver by either Party of any breach or default hereunder shall be deemed a waiver of any subsequent breach or default.
suggested_fix:
12.1 Entire Agreement. This Agreement is the entire agreement between the Parties on the subject matter herein and supersedes all prior or contemporaneous discussions, agreements, and understandings of any kind.

12.2 No Future Agreements. In the event the Parties elect not to pursue a new or expanded commercial relationship, all tangible Confidential Information shall be returned to the Discloser in accordance with Clause 7, unless the Parties subsequently enter into a written agreement to the contrary.

12.3 Amendments. No amendment to this Agreement shall be effective unless it is in writing and signed with a handwritten signature by authorized signatories of both Parties.

12.4 Waiver. Any forbearance or indulgence by either Party in any regard shall not constitute a waiver of the rights of that Party under this Agreement.

12.5 Severability. If any provision of this Agreement is held to be invalid, unenforceable, or illegal, such provision shall be severed from this Agreement, and the remainder of the Agreement shall remain in full force and effect, provided that the severance does not alter the fundamental purpose of this Agreement.

12.6 Governing Law. This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of ${country}.

12.7 Jurisdiction. The Recipient consents to the non-exclusive jurisdiction of the ${courts_of_jurisdiction} for any actions or proceedings that the Discloser may initiate in connection with this Agreement, notwithstanding that such actions or proceedings might otherwise be beyond the jurisdiction of said courts, without prejudice to the Discloser's right to initiate action in any other court that has jurisdiction.

12.8 Non-Exclusivity. The Discloser may provide goods or services to any other person or entity without restriction.

12.9 Costs. Each Party shall bear its own costs incurred in the drafting and negotiation of this Agreement.

12.10 Publicity. The Recipient shall not make or issue any formal or informal public announcement or statement in connection with this Agreement without the prior written consent of the Discloser.
